DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of the non-inferiority study is to evaluate the clinical efficacy and the safety of two different subcutaneous FSH preparations (Fostimon versus Gonal-F) for controlled ovarian hyperstimulation in a GnRH-antagonist cycle.
DOC.brief_title: FSH in GnRH-AntagoniST Controlled Ovarian Hyperstimulation Cycles (FAST)
DOC.criteria: Age: 1838 years old; BMI: 1828 kg/m2; Less than 3 previously completed IVF cycles; Basal FSH <10 IU/L and E2 <80 pg/ml; TSH < 2.5 mIU/L >10 and <30 antral follicles 210 mm in size for both ovaries combined AMH: >1 ng/ml (7.15 pmol/l) and <5.6 ng/ml (40.0 pmol/l) Presence and adequate visualization of both ovaries; Within 12 months of the beginning of the study, uterine cavity consistent with expected normal function as assessed through transvaginal ultrasound, hysterosalpingogram, sonohysterogram or hysteroscopic examination; Primary ovarian failure or women known as poor responders; PCO and PCOS; Severe OHSS in a previous COH cycle; Uterine malformation that may impair the possibility to get pregnant; Ovarian cysts >10 mm; Hydrosalpinx that have not been surgically removed or ligated; Endometriosis stage 3 or 4; Oocyte donation; Severe male factor; Pathologies associated with any contraindication of being pregnant; History of recurrent miscarriage (more than 3 previous miscarriages); Hypersensitivity to the study medication; Abnormal bleeding of undetermined origin; Uncontrolled thyroid or adrenal dysfunction; Neoplasias; Severe impairment of renal and/or hepatic function.
